page.title: 03The Domesday Project Poem
page.content:
Writing out interviews copying maps Working neatly,there's no mishaps, Houses built with cement and bricks Others were made with axes and picks Last time it was written was in 1086.
Visiting companies,going on walks Attending meetings,listening to talks Colouring pictures is all in our part, Looking at mudtracks used by a cart, Making school models in afternoon Art.
Drawing houses,studying their looks Reading the W.I.'s Jubilee Books, Watching crafts that go on in Longhope Walking down MayHill and its steep slanting slope Do the Domesday Project don't sit down and mope. By Polly Eldridge,age 11.
